avalancheActivity.comment:
Wind slabs are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. They remain for the foreseeable future prone to triggering in particular on steep shady slopes.
The wind slabs can be released by large loads in particular. The avalanche prone locations are to be found especially in gullies and bowls above approximately 2400 m and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs of the last few days must be evaluated with care and prudence in high Alpine regions.

snowpackStructure.comment: As a consequence of high temperatures and solar radiation the snowpack settled during the last few days. Snow depths vary greatly at intermediate and high altitudes, depending on the infuence of the wind. Fresh wind slabs have settled a little. Gradual decrease in avalanche danger as the temperature drops.

tendency.comment: Wind and new snow above approximately 1800 m. The avalanche danger will already increase in the early morning.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Older wind slabs can be released in some cases in particular on very steep shady slopes. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls above approximately 2500 m.
In isolated cases the avalanches are medium-sized and can mostly be released by large loads. In particular in high Alpine regions these avalanche prone locations are more prevalent.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs of the last few days represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to gradual consolidation of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. Snow depths vary greatly at intermediate and high altitudes, depending on the infuence of the wind. At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment: The more recent wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads, in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2700 m. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in gullies and bowls and in the vicinity of peaks. In some places wind slabs are lying on an icy crust. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger, especially along the border with France.

snowpackStructure.comment: Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to gradual consolidation of the snowpack. Below approximately 2200 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying. Above approximately 2500 m snow depths vary greatly at intermediate and high altitudes, depending on the infuence of the wind. Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to significant settling of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes.

avalancheActivity.comment: Even in moderately steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
avalancheActivity.highlights: From a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment: In all altitude zones hardly any snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment: Even in moderately steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
avalancheActivity.highlights: From a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment: In particular at low and intermediate altitudes hardly any snow is lying. Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to rapid settling of the snowpack in all aspects.
